intro: Mercurialis angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf mercury. It is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that are surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Mercurialis angustifolia is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
